Stem: Both submerged and floating on surface.
Leaves: Underwater they are grass-like in star shaped rosette. Above water they are oval shaped with rounded tips, and on stalks up to 8 cm long.
Flowers: White to pale blue, dark purplish-blue in the centre. With 6 petals. Usually in pairs but sometimes in groups of up to 10.
FruitSeeds: Tiny capsules up to 1 mm across. Containing 8-14 winged seeds.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinguished from Kidney-leaf mud-plantain (*Heteranthera reniformis*) by having underwater leaves and oval shaped leaves above surface.
